content.question:
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means was conducted to investigate whether there is a statistically significant difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat yogurt and the average amount of fat found in nonfat yogurt. With all conditions for inference met, the test produced a test statistic of <math alttext="t equals 2.201" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.201</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.027.
Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value and a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is the correct conclusion?

choices.label: Reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is less than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is not statistically significant.

Reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is less than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is statistically significant.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is less than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is not statistically significant.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is greater than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is statistically significant.

Fail to reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is greater than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is not statistically significant.

content.answer: Reject the null hypothesis because <math alttext="p is less than alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The difference in the average amount of fat found in low-fat and nonfat yogurt is statistically significant.

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
